title: 112_hr3898
content: The Act titled "Sunlight Act of 2012" requires specific dollar amounts for annual financial disclosure statements. The Ethics in Government Act of 1978 is amended to require exact dollar amounts in financial disclosures for Members of Congress and officers and employees of Congress. Additionally, reports filed under this Act will be made available to the public on the Internet in a searchable and sortable format. The amendment made by subsection (a) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 applies to reports filed for calendar years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3 amends the Rules of the House of Representatives to require the Clerk to display the subject matter of debates during general debate. SEC. 4 mandates the availability of bills, conference reports, and amendments on the internet before voting. Clause 11 of rule XXI of the Rules of the House of Representatives is amended to require bills, joint resolutions, conference reports, and amendments to be available on the internet for a specified period before consideration. The format must be searchable and sortable. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to mandate electronic filing for all reports, requiring each person to maintain and file reports in electronic form accessible by computers. Designations, statements, and reports are now referred to as documents, and any report, designation, or statement must be filed electronically. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 now requires all reports to be filed electronically in a searchable and sortable format on the internet. The terminology for designations, statements, and reports has been updated to refer to them as documents. Software for filing all reports electronically is also mandated. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 has been amended to require reports to be filed electronically. The terminology for designations, statements, and reports has been updated to refer to them as documents. Additionally, political committees are now required to notify the appropriate authorities of all contributions made within 30 days of an election and reports must be made within 24 hours. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 has been amended to require electronic filing of reports. Political committees must notify authorities of contributions within 30 days of an election, with reports due within 24 hours. Amendments apply to reports starting on or after January 1, 2013.
